Julian, the paper is probably a few months off.  We want to release
the gam=
e before publishing a paper because it will be a multiplayer
online game an=
d we want to be able to talk about how people play it in
the paper itself. =
 So we wanted to get the word out a little before
the game is actually rele=
ased to help attract potential players by the
time it is released.  We're h=
oping to make it genuinely fun and more
"mass-market" than NERO in the sens=
e that it's more action-oriented
and less a thinking-and-waiting type game.=


ken

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "Julian Togelius" <julian@...> wrote:
>=

> This looks very interesting! When will there be a paper available?
> 
> =
Julian
> 
> 2008/10/12 Kenneth Stanley <kstanley@...>:
> > Erin Hastings an=
d I have been leading a team of students for some time
> > on the problem o=
f automated content generation in video games through
> > evolutionary algo=
rithms. We're not quite at the release stage, but
> > some of you may be in=
terested to see what we're working on: It's a
> > multiplayer space shooter=
 called Galactic Arms Race (GAR) that
> > continually produces new kinds of=
 weapons based on the weapons people
> > have liked in the past. Weapons in=
 GAR are particle systems that are
> > controlled by CPPNs evolved with NEA=
T.
> >
> > You can see some screenshots and other information here:
> >
> >=
 http://gar.eecs.ucf.edu/
